title: What’s Behind the Stock Market’s Great Rotation
text:
It must be a pretty dull week in the stock market if everyone is talking about factors.

Stock groups with different characteristics—so-called factors—had been running in very different directions over the past few months. The market’s best performers, known as high-momentum stocks, and the least volatile, known as low-vol stocks, had outperformed as investors shunned the cheapest, smaller, more-volatile ones. In July, the performance gap between the two sides was wider than at any point in market history, according to J.P....
description: Momentum and low-volatility stocks are falling, while value stocks are showing signs of staging a comeback—at long last.
